commands.speaker: Kanan
commands.line: One, two, three, four... Hold on, you guys!

commands.speaker: Yoshiko
commands.line: What is it? We were just getting to the good part.

commands.speaker: Kanan
commands.line: The good part? What do you think you're practicing, exactly?

commands.speaker: Yoshiko
commands.line: We're practicing an all-group musical that we'll put on as a mini-segment during our next live show.

commands.speaker: Kanan
commands.line: That's right. And you volunteered to play the lead role of detective. That means you're the leader of this musical, Yoshiko!

commands.speaker: Kanan
commands.line: I think you should be more aware of your surroundings.

commands.speaker: Yoshiko
commands.line: Be aware of my surroundings? Am I not doing a good job? Do I fail as the leader?

commands.speaker: Kanan
commands.line: You're not failing! You wrote the script and cast the parts. You're working so hard! It's just...

commands.speaker: Yoshiko
commands.line: Just what? Tell me exactly what I did wrong!

commands.speaker: Kanan
commands.line: Okay, let me be straight with you. This play is about a detective and her assistant, or the lead and supporting roles, working together as one unit, right?

commands.speaker: Kanan
commands.line: I get that you're the detective and Hanayo is the assistant, but in your scenes together, the audience can't see Hanayo when you're standing in front of her.

commands.speaker: Yoshiko
commands.line: But shouldn't the lead role stand in front for more impact? The musical won't be as exciting if I blend into the background.

commands.speaker: Yoshiko
commands.line: My little demons are coming to see me, so I need to be visible to them. They're counting on me.

commands.speaker: Kanan
commands.line: Well... I admire your enthusiasm, but you two didn't say the catchphrase in sync in the last scene.

commands.speaker: Yoshiko
commands.line: I'll just practice it more, okay?

commands.speaker: Eli
commands.line: You've made your point, Kanan. Don't be discouraged, Yoshiko.

commands.speaker: Eli
commands.line: You could use the same advice, Hanayo.

commands.speaker: Hanayo
commands.line: Huh? M-Me?

commands.speaker: Eli
commands.line: You're the assistant, so your role is to support the detective, but there's more to it than that.

commands.speaker: Eli
commands.line: You're partners, complementing each other's traits and working together to solve a mysterious incident. You're two sides of the same coin. I think you should show that more.

commands.speaker: Hanayo
commands.line: O-Okay. I'll give it a try! Let's go again, please!

commands.speaker: Kanan
commands.line: All right everyone, let's call it a day!

commands.speaker: Yoshiko
commands.line: I'm leaving now. Come on, Hanayo!

commands.speaker: Hanayo
commands.line: O-Okay! Good work today, everyone!

commands.speaker: Kanata
commands.line: Yoshiko and Hanayo didn't act like a team today, even though they're supposed to be the detective and assistant.

commands.speaker: Eli
commands.line: I can tell they're trying, though...

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: Maybe doing a musical is a bit too challenging.

commands.speaker: Eli
commands.line: It is difficult, but we all agreed to put on a musical, so we have a collective duty to see it through.

commands.speaker: Kanata
commands.line: Yeah. Yoshiko's been really excited for it. She's trying her best, too. She was talking things over with Hanayo as they were leaving.

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: It's true. I'm just worried that she's trying so hard that it's giving her tunnel vision, though...

commands.speaker: Eli
commands.line: I know. It's good that she's staying accountable, but I don't want her to agonize over it.

commands.speaker: Eli
commands.line: It would be nice if Assistant Hanayo gave Detective Yoshiko her support, both in the play and in real life, but...that's easier said than done, I guess.

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: I wonder if there's any way we can help them?

commands.speaker: Ayumu, Eli, Kanan
commands.line: Hmm...

commands.speaker: Kanata
commands.line: Heh heh, never fear, Kanata is here! I actually have a good idea.
